name: My Bloody Valentine Market
description:
Hey, little devil! 

Join us we host over 35 artists and artisans of dark, alternative wares. Whether you're shopping for that perfect Valentine's gift for yourself or someone else, we'll have a curated collection of art, crafts, toys, clothes, decor, literature, taxidermy, oddities, and more, that is sure to please anyone with a dark and twisted heart.

Our market is (mostly) family-friendly and the bar will be open for customers to enjoy a beverage while they shop.

name: The Winter Chocolate Show
description:
Celebrate all things chocolate at our sixth annual show!

Spend a delicious day sampling, learning, and indulging with Canada's best craft chocolate makers and chocolatiers as we gather under one roof.

Explore a vibrant vendor market featuring award-winning bean-to-bar chocolate, unique bonbons,  confections and bars. 

Throughout the day, enjoy seminars and workshops on tasting chocolate, working with chocolate, and understanding the bean-to-bar process. Whether you're planning a fun outing with friends, a Galentine's Day celebration, or gearing up for a chocolate-filled Valentine's day, this event offers the perfect mix of discovery and indulgence.

name: Cowboy Junkies

location.name: Koerner Hall, Royal Conservatory of Music

description:
Toronto's alt-country and folk-rock legends make their long-awaited return.

Formed in Toronto in 1985 by Margo Timmins (vocalist), Michael Timmins (songwriter, guitarist), Peter Timmins (drummer), and Alan Anton (bassist). The Junkies first performed publicly at the Beverley Tavern and other clubs in Toronto's Queen Street West, including The Rivoli. 

Their 1986 debut album, produced by Canadian Peter Moore, was the blues-inspired "Whites Off Earth Now!!", recorded using an ambisonic microphone in the family garage.

The group's fame spread with their second album, "The Trinity Session", recorded in 1987 at Toronto's Church of the Holy Trinity. Their sound, again using the ambisonic microphone, and their mix of blues, country, folk, rock, and jazz earned them both critical attention and a cult following.

After the concert, enjoy a beverage and more music.

name: You're a Good Man Charlie Brown
description:
Based on the beloved comic strip by Charles M. Schulz enjoy the musical adventures of Charlie Brown and the entire Peanuts gang. 

Through hilarious scenes and toe-tapping songs, they explore life's great questions, all while playing baseball, struggling with homework, swooning over crushes, and celebrating the joy of friendship.

Photo-op with the cast after the show included with every purchase.

name: Riverdale Hub's Valentine's Artisan Market
description:
Celebrate love in all its forms!

Come to our market for the perfect chance to find something truly special. Explore thoughtful, handmade goods created by local artisans. Pick up meaningful gifts that say "thinking of you" in the most heartfelt way.
